messages.title: Building a brighter future for NE Fife
My pledges to you
messages.content: Seek to tackle the low wage economy in North East Fife. Ensure that all local young people have the opportunity of a job, apprenticeship or training. Campaign against SNP cuts to funding for the world-class research that takes place in our local universities. Support the NHS and nurses, and campaign for an NHS that's fit for Fife. Push for an increase in the construction of desperately needed affordable housing.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Tackle the low wage economy in North East Fife.
Ensure that all local young people have the opportunity of a job, apprenticeship or training.
Campaign against SNP cuts to funding for world-class research in local universities.
Support the NHS and nurses, and campaign for an NHS that's fit for Fife.
Push for an increase in the construction of desperately needed affordable housing.

leaflet.personalStatement: Brian Thomson was elected as the first-ever Labour councillor in North East Fife in 2012...

politicalExperience.achievements: Delivering a development programme of affordable housing...

images.caption: Brian Thomson, Scottish Labour candidate for North East Fife

leaflet.additionalNotes: Brian is a keen golfer, runner and footballer, and is a member of St Andrews Golf Club and Fife Athletic Club.
